text: Cream the butter or margarine and sugar together. Continue mixing until it turns light and fluffy. Add the flour and salt. Mix through until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Pour in the milk. Mix through until a soft dough forms. Knead the dough. Once kneaded, form it into a sausage shape and cover with plastic food wrap. Place the rolled up dough into the refrigerator. Leave until it chills completely. Remove the cookie roll from the refrigerator when you are ready to bake. Preheat the oven to 170ºC/325ºF. Slice the roll into rounds. Place on a greased tray readied for baking. Press in nuts, sprinkle on sugar, etc., at this stage if the topping is also to be baked. Place in the oven. Bake for 10 minutes, or until the cookies start to brown. Remove from the oven and leave to cool. Ice/decorate as wished. These also worked well stuck together with jam, frosting, etc.
